name: Westwater Resources, Inc.
description: Westwater Resources, Inc. is a mineral exploration and development company focused on the advancement of battery-grade natural graphite and other critical minerals. Founded in 2010 and headquartered in Denver, Colorado, Westwater aims to play a crucial role in the burgeoning electric vehicle (EV) market and the global transition to renewable energy. The company owns the Kellyton graphite processing facility in Alabama and is developing a portfolio of projects that includes the Coosa graphite project, which is one of the largest known graphite resources in the United States. Westwater is committed to sustainable mining practices and environmental stewardship, ensuring that their operations minimize impact while maximizing resource recovery. With increasing demand for lithium-ion batteries and renewable energy technologies, Westwater is strategically positioned to supply the necessary materials that will power the future of clean energy. The company's mission is to provide high-quality, domestically sourced graphite to meet the needs of the growing EV and energy storage industries while contributing to a sustainable future.

seo.meta_title: Westwater Resources, Inc. | Leading Supplier of Battery-Grade Graphite
seo.meta_description: Westwater Resources, Inc. is focused on developing battery-grade graphite and critical minerals. Learn about our projects and commitment to sustainable practices.

faq.question: What does Westwater Resources do?
faq.answer: Westwater Resources focuses on the exploration and development of battery-grade natural graphite and other critical minerals.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of Westwater Resources?
faq.answer: Christopher M. Jones is the CEO of Westwater Resources, Inc.

faq.question: Where is Westwater Resources headquartered?
faq.answer: Westwater Resources is headquartered in Denver, Colorado, USA.

faq.question: What are the main products of Westwater Resources?
faq.answer: Westwater's main products include battery-grade graphite and graphite concentrate.
